overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a structured approach to time-series forecasting for hourly LUFL data, starting with model consideration and concluding with a simple averaging method due to data limitations. The analyst identifies daily seasonality but acknowledges insufficient data for complex models, opting for a practical solution that leverages observed patterns.
common_data_patterns: Lower values at night, higher during daytime
key_insights: Limited data (only 4 days) restricts complex model feasibility (e.g., SARIMA)
Hourly averaging effectively captures daily patterns with minimal data
Weekly seasonality ignored due to insufficient historical cycles
Data rounding to 3 decimals maintains consistency with input format
Forecast repetition assumes pattern stability across future days
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex initial analysis (evaluating SARIMA/ETS), simplifying to heuristic execution. Focuses on practical implementation constraints over theoretical optimization.
